sect1.para: Below is the list of advisories applicable to the NetBSD 2.1 release:

itemizedlist.listitem:
A description and resolution procedure for BIND cryptographically weak query IDs can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2007-007

A description and resolution procedure for IPv6 Type 0 Routing Header can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2007-005

A description and resolution procedure for Insufficient length checking in iso(4) can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2007-004

A description and resolution procedure for Integer overflows in Render and DBE extensions can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2007-002

A description and resolution procedure for Integer overflow in ktruser() can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2007-001

A description and resolution procedure for libc glob(3) buffer overflow can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-027

A description and resolution procedure for Multiple denial of service issues can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-026

A description and resolution procedure for Multiple information/memory leakage issues can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-025

A description and resolution procedure for systrace(4) integer overflow can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-024

A description and resolution procedure for OpenSSL RSA Signature Forgery can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-023

A description and resolution procedure for Integer overflows in CID-keyed font parser can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-021

A description and resolution procedure for Integer overflows in PCF font parsers can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-020

A description and resolution procedure for Malicious PPP options can overrun a kernel buffer can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-019

A description and resolution procedure for sail(6), dm(8) and tetris(6) buffer overflows can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-018

A description and resolution procedure for Sendmail malformed multipart MIME messages can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-017

A description and resolution procedure for IPv6 socket options can crash the system can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-016

A description and resolution procedure for FPU Information leak on i386/amd64/Xen platforms with AMD CPUs can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-015

A description and resolution procedure for sysctl(3) local denial of service can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-013

A description and resolution procedure for SIOCGIFALIAS ioctl may cause system crash can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-012

A description and resolution procedure for IPSec replay attack can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-011

A description and resolution procedure for Sendmail race condition can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-010

A description and resolution procedure for False detection of Intel hardware RNG can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-009

A description and resolution procedure for Malformed ELF interpreter causes system crash can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-008

A description and resolution procedure for mail(1) creates record file with insecure umask can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-007

A description and resolution procedure for bridge memory disclosure can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-005

A description and resolution procedure for Multiple denial of services issues with racoon can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-003

A description and resolution procedure for settimeofday() time wrap can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-002

A description and resolution procedure for Kernfs kernel memory disclosure can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2006-001

A description and resolution procedure for ptrace() permissions after S[UG]ID and exec() can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2005-013

A description and resolution procedure for SO_LINGER argument checking DIAGNOSTIC panic can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2005-012

A description and resolution procedure for ntpd may start with different group id than desired can be found in
NetBSD Security Advisory NetBSD-SA2005-011
